question: A 13-year-old female presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with on and off menorrhagia, bleeding gums, and petechial rashes. Her laboratory reports show the following results; Hb= 12.5 g/dl, platelet count= 350,000/mm3, activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT)= 49s (normal: 29-40s). Which of the following could be the likely diagnosis?

A child with a bone marrow disorder is undergoing a blood transfusion. He has also been given 400 ml citrate intravenously to prevent blood clotting. After three transfusions, which of the following conditions will be observed in the child’s blood?
Where are white infarcts usually seen?
Classic hemophilia is caused by the deficiency of which of the following?
Which of the following is a direct plasminogen activator?
Pernicious anemia is a type of megaloblastic anemia. What may cause it?
Which one of the following plays a vital role in the maturation of red blood cells?
Where are most of the body's iron reserves found?
Which of the following is the lymphoid organ with outer darkly staining and inner lightly staining regions with patches of acidophilic type?
Which of the following is the best test for the diagnosis of malaria?
Which interleukin is required for the growth and proliferation of all the stem cells?
The receptor for IgG is present on phagocytes. Which of the following are phagocytes?

A 13-year-old girl falls and hits her head on the wall, leading to trauma of the blood vessels. Tissue thromboplastin will be released by the endothelial cells. Which of the following factors will be involved in initiating coagulation?
Which antibody has a pentameric structure?
Which of the following components are involved in the first step of heme synthesis?
Which of the following factors is immediately released from the injured vascular endothelium to cause vasoconstriction?

A 7-year-old boy developed vesicles and bullae on his face and arms due to prolonged sun exposure from participating in sports activities. His father had a similar condition. He is suspected of porphyria cutanea tarda. Which of the following enzymes is mainly deficient in the above-mentioned disease condition?
Which of the following is the region in the primary structure of immunoglobulins that determines the antibody class?
C-reactive protein, which is elevated in case of inflammation and infection, falls into the category of which of the following plasma proteins?

A 55-year-old man was diagnosed with constrictive pericarditis, two years after suffering from trauma to the heart. When he died an autopsy was performed. The heart was encased in a thickened, fibrotic pericardium. The pericardium was attached to the heart by a stingy material that was difficult to remove. What type of inflammation did the patient have in his pericardium?
A 65-year-old woman is being treated for pain and inflammation in her joints for the past year. Which of the following statements regarding the patient's inflammation is correct?

answers.option: It may result in granulomas composed of epithelial cells and blood vessels
It involves co-existence of inflammation, tissue repair and attempts at repair
It always follows the acute inflammation
It is predominantly characterized by a neutrophilic infiltrate

question: An individual sprains their ankle while hiking in the mountains and it becomes inflamed. Which of the following statements is most correct regarding this type of inflammation?

answers.option: The cellular infiltrate comprises of macrophages and lymphocytes
It is not associated with tissue damage
It is characterized by the formation of granulomas
It is characterized heat, redness, pain and swelling

question: The blood remains in circulation because of a balance between procoagulant and anticoagulant forces. Proteolytic destruction of which of the following by the protein C inhibits the process of coagulation?

answers.option: Activated factor I and factor IV
Activated factor X and factor XI
Activated factor V and factor VIII
Activated factor II and factor III
Activated factor VII and factor X

question: Which of the following terms best describes the occurrence of a disease in a community or region with a frequency clearly in excess of normal expectancy?

Which of the following terms best describes the disease causation model that can be used for explaining the mechanism of chronic disease occurrence like diabetes and heart disease with multiple risk factors?

The complement system is a system of about 20 different proteins which perform important defensive functions in the body. there are three pathways of complement activation, classical pathway, alternate pathway, and mannose-binding lecithin pathway. These pathways merge at which of the following stages?

answers.option: Formation of the membrane attack complex (MAC)

question: A 45-year-old woman develops swelling in her lower legs and feet after standing for long periods at the end of her 8-hour shift with no associated pain or erythema. There is no swelling at the beginning of her day. Her kidney and liver are also in healthy condition. What is the probable diagnosis for her condition?

answers.option: Increased hydrostatic pressure due to heart failure

question: Which is the characteristic morphology of red blood cells seen in megaloblastic anemia?
Which is the characteristic morphology of white blood cells seen in megaloblastic anemia?
A child gets a micro-cut on his finger while playing with a razor. The wound stops bleeding shortly after. Which of the following mechanisms is primarily responsible for this?
Which disease occurs when the hydrophilic amino acid glutamic acid is replaced by the hydrophobic amino acid valine at position 6 in the globin chain?
If the set point for diabetes mellitus in a population was 105 mg/dL and the researcher dropped it to 100 mg/dL. What will be the change in sensitivity and specificity?

answers.option: No change in sensitivity or specificity

question: Which of the following represents the clinicopathological representation of Arthus reaction?
Which one of the following types of cells starts their existence in the bone marrow, and gives rise to all blood cells on its own?
Why is blood classified as a special connective tissue?

answers.option: It consists of hydroxyapatite crystals in its matrix
It is composed of cells and fibers
It has a greater ratio of cells than fibers
It has fluid nature of its ground substance

question: Which one of the following is an unencapsulated lymphatic tissue found in the human body?
In comparison to primitive hematopoiesis, which of the following is not the feature of definitive hematopoiesis (DH)?

answers.option: During definitive hematopoiesis, red blood cells do not have the nuclei
Definitive hematopoiesis begins in fetal life
During definitive hematopoiesis, many types of white blood cells are produced
Definitive hematopoiesis starts in yolk sac

question: A biopsy specimen of the thymus from an old man is examined under the microscope and many whorl-like corpuscles are observed. Which of the following statement truly matches the corpuscles mentioned above?

answers.option: They are composed of epithelial reticular cells (type VI)
They are derived from T memory cells
They are mainly located in the thymic cortex
They are frequently seen in thymus of young individuals
They have their embryological origin from mesoderm

question: Which of the following proteins stimulates the expansion and multiplication of nearly all types of stem cells?
Which of the following cells does erythropoietin stimulate to enhance RBC synthesis?
Which of the following have MHC-I molecules present on their surfaces?

A middle-aged obese doctor presents to the emergency room with complaints of significant left-sided chest "tightness" and pain that radiates to his left arm and jaw. He was given streptokinase when he was diagnosed with a heart attack four months back. The patient went into shock after receiving a fibrinolytic drug due to a hypersensitivity reaction. Which fibrinolytic agent did the patient receive this time?
Which of the following terms denotes the average weight of hemoglobin in an individual erythrocyte?

A 40-year-old man was recovered after having walked for hours, two days after becoming lost in a sweltering and humid wilderness. His complete blood picture showed increased hematocrit. Which of the following is a likely diagnosis?
The hematocrit of a person with a tumor-like disease is elevated. What value of hematocrit value would you most likely expect to see?
Which one of the following values corresponds to the percentage of hemoglobin A2 (HbA₂) in a normal adult person?

A 44-year-old man discovers he is positive for HIV after a blood donation screening. The screening of blood work shows hemoglobin of 10 g/dL, hematocrit 30%, total leukocyte count 4600/mm³, platelet count 15,000/mm³, prothrombin time 12 seconds (INR=1.1), and partial thromboplastin time 23 seconds. Which physical finding is most likely in this patient?

A 44-year-old man is treated with high doses of rabbit anti-thymocyte globulin for bone marrow failure. He develops fever, lymphadenopathy, arthralgias, and erythema of the hands and feet arise ten days later. Which of the following is the most probable explanation for these signs and symptoms?

answers.option: Cytokine secretion by natural killer cells

question: A 20-year-old lady visits the doctor, after five years of significant menstrual bleeding. She complains of easy bruising and states that bleeding from a tiny finger cut lasts longer than normal. Lab results show a hemoglobin of 10.5g/dL, and a platelet count of 275,000/mm^3, with normal platelet aggregation. Prothrombin time is 10.5 seconds (INR = 1.0) and аctivated partial thromboplastin time is 28 sec. Pap smear shows no abnormalities. Which of the following hematologic disorders is the most likely cause of this patient's menorrhagia?
After the breakdown of red blood cells, which of the following proteins binds hemoglobin to be cleared by liver macrophages?
Which of the following features characterizes fetal hemoglobin compared to adult hemoglobin?

answers.option: It possesses more affinity for oxygen
It unloads oxygen to tissues with difficulty
It shows lesser oxygen content at a given partial pressure of oxygen

question: A 5-year-old child was brought to a clinic with complaints of high-grade fever, pain in the throat, and difficulty in swallowing. Examination and a blood test confirmed the diagnosis of acute bacterial infection of the tonsils. Which of the following cells would be increased in blood in this condition?

A 68-year-old male with carcinoma of the lung was given subcutaneous heparin to prevent any intravascular coagulation. The activity of this anticoagulant is increased when it combines with a protein. Which one of the following proteins shows this effect?

A young woman presents to the outpatient department with complaints of being exhausted and short of breath when she tries to do anything. She has a respiratory rate of 18 breaths per minute and is quite pale. Hemoglobin is 10 g/dL according to the lab results. What is the approximate amount of oxygen that is transported by each one hundred milliliters of her blood?

A 65-year-old woman arrives at the orthopedic department with joint pain. Her doctor diagnoses her with osteoarthritis and osteoporosis. She is prescribed NSAIDs, calcium, and vitamin D. She returns after six months on the same medication, pale and short of breath. Her MCV is 73 fL and her hemoglobin was 9 g/dL. What could be the cause of low hemoglobin?

A 24-year-old Indian male arrives at the emergency room with severe chest and back pain that started three hours earlier while he was ascending a mountain and was short of breath. He states that he experienced identical symptoms several years earlier. Lab tests show that hemoglobin is 10 g/dL, total leukocyte count is 12,000/mm3, MCV is 87 fL, and reticulocytes are 25%. What could be his diagnosis?

A manufacturing company worker who looks sick, feverish, and tired, complains of bleeding from the nose and gums. The laboratory findings show that the patient has low levels of hemoglobin, white blood cells, and platelets, as well as a low reticulocyte count and a mean corpuscular volume of 88 fL. What could be the potential diagnosis?

A 27-year-old Ethiopian male presents to the outpatient department with breathlessness. He has a high heart rate and pale oral mucosa and conjunctiva. His initial blood tests showed 7.8 g/dL hemoglobin and 65 fL MCV. The doctor advises iron studies, which are normal. What could be the diagnosis?

A 24-year-old media sciences student presents with exhaustion, nausea, and vomiting for one week. She also has a low-grade fever and visited the outpatient department after observing yellow skin and sclera. Abdominal examination reveals right upper abdominal discomfort. Her liver tests are abnormal. She is diagnosed with hepatitis A after testing. Which immunity will she build from her acute viral infection?

A young man presented to the outpatient department with complaints of fever for 5 days and body aches. He has stable blood pressure, 103° C temperature, 110 beats/min pulse, and 20 breaths/min respiration. His total leukocyte count was 2500/μL. Which reflects his condition best?
Elevated concentration of lactate in the plasma is associated with which of the following?
When interpreting an iron profile, which of the following parameters is the most reliable indicator of iron deficiency?
Which of the following is the first bile pigment produced in the catabolism of heme molecule?
What is the net yield of ATP molecules produced by the glycolysis of one glucose molecule in red blood cells?
Which form of vitamin K is required for the activation of clotting factors?

The plasma proteins electrophoresis shows two major protein electrophoretic bands, one for albumin and the other for globulin. Globulin further gives different fractions. These are α1 globulins, α2 globulin, β1 globulin, β2 globulin, and γ globulins. Which of the following is the protein present in the γ globulin fraction?
What is the most characteristic feature of granulation tissue?

answers.option: Growth of fibroblasts and new capillaries

question: A 25-year-old male patient visited the outpatient department with complaints of shortness of breath at rest. His chest is normal on auscultation and there are no visible signs of lung disease on X-ray. He has low hemoglobin and an MCV of 105 fL based on his blood tests. Multisegmented neutrophils are not seen on blood smear. What could be the cause of his anemia?

A 52-year-old man noted a darkly pigmented "mole" on the back of his hand. During the past month, the lesion has gradually enlarged and bled spontaneously. On examination, there is a slightly raised, darkly pigmented, 1.2 cm lesion on the dorsum of the right hand. The lesion is completely excised. Microscopically, malignant melanoma is diagnosed. Which of the following factors is associated with the greatest risk for the development of this neoplasm?

A 41-year-old man comes into the medical outpatient department with complaints of weight loss, nausea, and vomiting for 5 months. He works at a factory that produces plastic pipes. On physical examination, he has tenderness to palpation in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen with hepatomegaly. An abdominal CT scan shows a 12 cm mass in the right lobe of the liver. A liver biopsy is performed, and a microscopic examination shows an angiosarcoma. The patient has most likely been exposed to which of the following agents?

An 18-year-old male comes to the outpatient department with a palpable mass on the right side of his neck for 6 months. On physical examination, there is a 2 cm, firm, non-tender nodule involving the right lobe of the thyroid gland. Biopsy specimens of the nodule showed features consistent with carcinoma of the thyroid. No positive family history was found. Which of the following is relevant in the woman's past medical history?

A 58-year-old woman experienced an increased feeling of fullness in the neck for the past 3 months and noted a 3 kg weight loss during that time. On physical examination, there is a firm, fixed mass in a 3 × 5 cm area on the right side of the neck. A biopsy of the mass is performed. All areas of the tumor have similar morphology. Which of the following terms best describes this neoplasm?
Malignant neoplasms can be categorized as carcinomas and sarcomas. Which of the following statements describes carcinoma?

answers.option: Arising exclusively from the cells of mesodermal origin
Arising exclusively from the cells of endodermal origin
Arising from sheets of solid mesenchyme
Arising exclusively from the cells of ectodermal origin

question: A 26-year-old woman has a lump in her left breast. On physical examination, the physician finds an irregular, firm, 2 cm mass in the upper inner quadrant of the breast. A fine-needle aspirate of the mass shows carcinoma. The patient's 30-year-old sister was recently diagnosed with ovarian cancer, and 3 years ago her maternal aunt was diagnosed with ductal carcinoma of the breast and had a mastectomy. Which of the following genes is most likely to have undergone mutation to produce these findings

A first-year medical student develops pneumonia and is in the hospital for a week. Two weeks after hospital discharge, he develops a fever and begins coughing up thick, whitish, foul-smelling sputum. Computed tomography (CT) scan chest shows a localized collection of thick fluid in the lung. How would you best describe the outcome of acute inflammation in this patient?
What term best describes the type of inflammation in a 4-year-old child with redness and blister formation on the hands after accidental contact with boiling water?
Which statement best describes autosomal dominant disorders?
An affected male does not transmit the disorder to his sons, but all daughters are carriers. Which pattern of inheritance corresponds to the above statement?
Which cell type is most likely to be increased in a first year medical student experiencing excessive sneezing and watering of the eyes every year during spring and summer?

A 34-year-old man complains of epigastric pain. Endoscopy reveals a shallow sharply demarcated ulcer in the gastric antrum. Biopsy findings include lymphocyte, macrophage, and plasma cell infiltration, along with granulation tissue formation and fibrosis. What term best describes the type of inflammation observed in this man?
What does the membrane attack complex (MAC) formed during complement activation consist of?

answers.option: C5b, C6, C7, C8, and C9

question: What initiates the classical pathway of complement activation?

answers.option: Binding of C-reactive protein (CRP) to microbial surfaces
Binding of mannose-binding lectin (MBL) to microbial surfaces

question: Which of the following is correct regarding the inflammation in a 65-year-old man with a 5-year history of osteoarthritis?

answers.option: Granuloma formation as a constant feature in these patients
Plasma cells and B lymphocytes being almost never found
Neutrophilic exudate with pus formation on biopsy
Cytokines and growth factors having no role in this type of inflammation
Alternatively activated macrophages promoting tissue repair

question: Complement deficiencies lead to an increased risk of which of the following?
What is the involvement of the major histocompatibility complex (MHC)?

In a normal distribution curve, what percentage of the curve is represented by the shaded area under the curve with ±1 SD (plus minus one standard deviation around the mean) on either side of the mean value?
What does sterilization refer to?

answers.option: Killing or removing all forms of microbial life
Removing visible dirt from a surface
Reducing the number of microorganisms to a safe level

question: What is the most resistant form of microbial life to physical and chemical agents?
What do agents referred to as "bactericidal" do?

A 19-year-old woman came into the medical outpatient department with a history of frequent nosebleeds and increased menstrual flow. On physical examination, petechiae and purpura are present on the skin of her extremities. Laboratory studies show normal partial thromboplastin time (APTT), prothrombin time (PT), platelet count, and decreased von Willebrand factor activity. This patient most likely has a derangement in which of the following steps in hemostasis?

A 23-year-old pregnant woman has macrocytic anemia, an increased serum concentration of transferrin, and a normal serum concentration of vitamin B12. The most likely cause of her anemia is a deficiency of which of the following?
A 20-year-old woman presents to her primary care physician with heavy menstrual bleeding. Her physician prescribes tranexamic acid. What is tranexamic acid's mechanism of action?

A medical study is conducted to estimate the prevalence of hypertension amongst a defined population and evaluate people of different ages, ethnicities, geographical locations, and social backgrounds. Which one of the following options best describes the type of study design most appropriate for the above study?

In a study that began in 2001, a group of 3500 adults in Islamabad were asked about alcohol consumption. The occurrence of cases of liver cancer between 2018-2023 was studied in this group. What is the above study design?
A research paper states that: "To access the frequency of mood disorders among medical students of Karachi." Which of the following best describes the statement in the above scenario?

In a small study, 12 women with ovarian cancer and 12 women with no apparent disease were asked whether they had ever used estrogen. Each woman with cancer was matched by age, race, weight, and parity to a woman without disease. Identify the study design.

"Like cases should be treated as like, and the benefits and the risks associated with research must be allocated equitably across patients." Which of the following best expresses this principle of medical ethics?

A group of medical students started researching the health issues and quality of life of commercial sex workers. For data collection, they would have to go to various unsuitable places. They spent a year trying to collect data but enrolled a dozen participants. They became discouraged and left the study altogether. Which of the following options best describes the factor ignored by the students while deciding the research topic?

A researcher of a new drug trial informed the volunteers about the possible benefits of a new drug under trial in that study. She deliberately laid more emphasis on the possible benefits of the drug under trial and avoided discussion of the possible adverse effects of the drug to enrolled participants to increase participation. Which of the following identifies the central ethical principle lacking in the above scenario?

A 25-year-old male patient presents with a history of irrelevant talks, anger, and suspicion towards family members, had a big fight with the family, and injured the younger with an iron rod. He has been brought to you for treatment. Which of the following would you consider before initiating an interview with him?

answers.option: Inquire about any danger objects with the patient
Talk to the security guard and restraint the patient forcefully
Wait for the patient's violent reaction to happen in the ward
Talk to the family and ask them to leave the patient alone
Ask the staff to hold the patient and sedate him immediately

question: During the case discussion in the ward, you noticed that the safety measures in place for your junior doctor, who is responsible for taking psychiatric history from a violent patient, are inadequate. What would you advise your junior doctor?

answers.option: Postpone the interview until all safety measures have been ensured
Ignore the family’s account of the patient and his violent acts
Wait for 72 hours to take the history from the patient
Safety is not important as compared to the patient's illness
Reassure your junior doctor and ask her to take a complete history

question: A 22-year-old male presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of swelling in the neck region for 10-12 days. He does not give any history of flu or sore throat. Physical examination revealed right anterior cervical lymph nodes, about 1.0 cm in size., soft, non-tender, and mobile i.e. not fixed. The spleen is also enlarged. There is no other positive finding. What should be the next step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Reassure the patient and send him home

question: Hemostasis is the natural process that stops blood loss when an injury occurs. Which of the following bleeding manifestations or associations suggests secondary hemostatic disorder?

A 65-year-old male presents with a 2 months history of fever, lethargy, and night sweats. On physical examination, he has palpable cervical and axillary lymph nodes. The spleen is palpable 2 cm below the left costal margin. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 62-year-old woman complains of fatigue and numbness in her arms and legs for 1 month and takes thyroid replacement therapy for hypothyroidism. She has a long history of diarrhea on and off. A complete blood count (CBC) shows white blood cells (WBC) 3.8x10^9/L (normal: 4.0 to 11 x 10^9/L), hemoglobin (Hb) 8g/dL (normal: 12 to 16g/dL), hematocrit (Hct) 27 percent (normal: 36 to 46 percent), mean corpuscular volume (MCV) 120 fL (normal: 80 to 100fL), and platelets 115x109/L (normal: 150 to 400x10^9/L). She is diagnosed as a case of megaloblastic anemia with vitamin B12 deficiency. Which of the following autoantibodies is most likely present in this patient?
Which of the following is a characteristic of megaloblastic anemia?

answers.option: Serum vitamin B12 will be increased

question: Antibody-mediated hypersensitivity primarily occurs where?

answers.option: On the cell surface and in the matrix

question: A patient with chest pain and a history of recurrent respiratory infections was given antibiotics, a vaccine, and chest physiotherapy. He was also recommended a sputum test for tuberculosis. Which one of the following is considered primary prevention?
Which of the following is not classified as a hematinic?

A 45-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of fatigue and a feeling of fullness in his left upper abdomen. He has no history of trauma but reports recent weight loss and night sweats. On physical examination, the physician suspects splenomegaly. Which of the following is true regarding the physical examination of an enlarged spleen?

answers.option: It does not move during inspiration
It is always associated with hepatomegaly
It is palpated on the right side of the abdomen

question: Which type of polycythemia is associated with low levels of erythropoietin?
Which condition is associated with physiological polycythemia?
A person from a hill station presents with shortness of breath (SOB). What type of polycythemia will be seen in this person?
Fat embolism typically manifests within how many days?
Which of the following lymphoid organs has an outer darkly staining cortex and an inner lightly staining medulla with nodules?
Which characteristic is indicative of a benign tumor?
Which complement protein is commonly used to diagnose complement system disorders?
What is a potential consequence of ileectomy?
Which drug stops fibrinolysis by acting on plasminogen?
The complement system consists of proteins that play a crucial role in the immune response against pathogens. This system can be severely compromised by which of the following?
Positive reinforcement is an example of which of the following?
Which type of cell is lobulated with one lobe having an appendage like a drumstick in a female?
During hepatic surgery, doctors observed profuse bleeding and found that an intravenous injection had been given prior to the operation. What was the most likely type of injection administered?
Which enzyme is responsible for the formation of delta-aminolevulinic acid?
What is the tumor that arises from all three germ layers?
Which of the following final product of the classical complement pathway?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the classical pathway of the complement system?

answers.option: C1 stimulates histamine release from mast cells
Binding of mannose-binding lectin (MBL) to microbial surfaces

question: In Wuhan, China, a story emerged about people becoming sick with pneumonia of unknown cause. Eleven people were in critical condition, 44 in stable condition. If a researcher were to publish the findings of this investigation, what method of study would be used?
Out of 1000 individuals, 25 with gonorrhea tested positive, and 75 without gonorrhea tested positive. What is the positive predictive value (PPV)?
An embolus can cause which of the following conditions?
When cells undergo injury, they may enter a state of quiescence or apoptosis. Which gene drives all these processes?
Which vitamin is required for lifelong treatment after a gastrectomy?
Which of the following organ dysfunctions is most likely to cause edema?
Which of the following best describes a graph with 2 peaks and 2 humps?
What does differentiation in tumors refer to?

answers.option: Degree of similarity to normal cells

question: In cellular differentiation, which characteristic does a cell acquire?

answers.option: Resembles stromal myxoid cells in parenchymal tissue

question: Post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis is an example of which type of hypersensitivity?
The urine analysis of a patient with porphyria revealed delta amino levulinic acid (ALA) and porphobilinogen (PBG). What is the most likely diagnosis?

A woman, with a history of two miscarriages, presents with hemorrhagic ischemia in the head and a false positive syphilis test. Laboratory studies show normal platelet count and increased partial thromboplastin time (aPTT). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
12 women with endometrial cancer and 12 without were asked whether they had used estrogen. What kind of research study design was used in this case?
Which organ dysfunction is most likely to cause a decrease in hemoglobin and red blood cell count only?
How much data is included in 1 standard deviation from the mean?
In dengue, the levels of which of the following are affected the most?
Which of the following is most likely to cause systemic inflammation and, subsequently, shock?
What is the blood group if a blood sample shows agglutination with both anti-A and anti-D antibodies?
A 19-year-old woman does gardening in the morning without wearing a hat or sunscreen. One evening, her partner remarks that her skin appears red. Which dermal change has caused this appearance?
How many gene copies of the alpha chain of hemoglobin exist?
Which of the accumulates in the body as a result of variegate porphyria?
The activity of which of the following increases when heparin binds to it?
A person with blood type OO will have which agglutinogens and agglutinins?

answers.option: A and B agglutinogens, no agglutinins
No agglutinogens, A and B agglutinins

question: A 30-year-old patient presents with shortness of breath and bilateral lung opacities. There is no significant medical history, but the patient has a recent history of a femur fracture. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the predominant site of red blood cell production during the second trimester?

A 30-year-old lady presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of pain in her left upper abdomen. On physical examination, the spleen was found to be enlarged. Which histological feature is inappropriate for this organ?
At what age range are the maximum levels of agglutinins typically observed?

Some students wanted to do a cross-sectional study on the quality of life of transgender and intersex individuals. Collecting data involved visiting faraway places, hence they could collect only a few dozen responses. Out of frustration, they abandoned the project. Which key aspect did the students overlook before starting their study?
Which of the following factors is deficient in classic hemophilia?
The peripheral smear of an anemic patient shows a normocytic normochromic picture. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the anemia?
Which of the following is true for paradoxical emboli?

answers.option: Pass through the interatrial septum to systemic circulation
Pass through the aorta to systemic circulation
Pass through the interatrial septum to the pulmonary circulation

question: Which of the following factors causes the hemoglobin-oxygen dissociation curve to shift to the left?
During antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC), antibody-coated cells bind to receptors on which of the following cells?
Which of the following is a risk factor for atherosclerosis?
